item.title: 19 ways to ruin a survey
item.dc:creator: Nathan Ziarek
item.content:encoded:
Jared Spool pretty much obliterates United’s WiFi survey. My favorite:

Crappy Survey Lesson #14: Don’t bother with good English. “On which airline did you last use a Wi-Fi service onboard?” It’s a one sentence question. Convoluted grammar doesn’t help the experience.

Definitely worth a read.

(via UIE: 19 Lessons from United Airlines on How To Build A Crappy Survey
